\documentclass[english,12pt]{article}
\usepackage[T1]{fontenc}
\usepackage[latin9]{inputenc}
\usepackage{amstext}
\usepackage{amssymb}

\makeatletter
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% User specified LaTeX commands.
\usepackage[margin=1in]{geometry}

\makeatother

\usepackage{babel}
\begin{document}

\title{Math 525: Assignment 5}

\date{\date{}}
\maketitle
\begin{enumerate}
\item Let $X$, $Y$, and $Z$ be square integrable random variables such
that $X$ and $Y$ are independent. Show that
\[
\mathbb{E}\left[XYZ\right]\leq\sqrt{\mathbb{E}\left[X^{2}\right]\mathbb{E}\left[Y^{2}\right]\mathbb{E}\left[Z^{2}\right]}.
\]
\item Let $X$ be an integrable random variable with moment generating function
$M$. Show that $M(\theta)\geq e^{\theta\mathbb{E}[X]}$ whenever
$e^{\theta X}$ is integrable.
\item Let $p$ be a positive integer and $(X_{n})_{n}$ be a sequence of
random variables satisfying
\[
\mathbb{E}\left[\left|X_{n}\right|^{p}\right]\leq f(n)
\]
where $f$ satisfies $\sum_{n}f(n)<\infty$. Show that
\[
\lim_{n}X_{n}=0\text{ a.s.}
\]
\textbf{Hint}: use Markov's inequality and the Borel-Cantelli lemma.
\end{enumerate}

\end{document}
